title: Compiler Rejects `@ ..= xx as xx` in Pattern Matching

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: A-parser
labels.description: Area: The parsing of Rust source code to an AST.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-patterns
labels.description: Relating to patterns and pattern matching

body:
### Code

```Rust
let n = 32_usize;
let bug = match n {
    n @ ..= u8::MAX as usize => true,
    _ => false,
};
```


### Affected release channels

- [ ] Previous Stable
- [X] Current Stable
- [ ] Current Beta
- [X] Current Nightly

### Rust Version

```Shell
rustc 1.66.0 (69f9c33d7 2022-12-12)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 69f9c33d71c871fc16ac445211281c6e7a340943
commit-date: 2022-12-12
host: aarch64-apple-darwin
release: 1.66.0
LLVM version: 15.0.2
```


### Current error output

```Shell
error: expected one of `::`, `=>`, `if`, or `|`, found keyword `as`
 --> src/main.rs:4:25
  |
4 |         n @ ..= u8::MAX as usize => true,
  |                         ^^ expected one of `::`, `=>`, `if`, or `|`

error: could not compile `bug` due to previous error
```


### Backtrace

```Shell
error: expected one of `::`, `=>`, `if`, or `|`, found keyword `as`
 --> src/main.rs:4:25
  |
4 |         n @ ..= u8::MAX as usize => true,
  |                         ^^ expected one of `::`, `=>`, `if`, or `|`

error: could not compile `bug` due to previous error
```


### Anything else?

change to `n @ ..= (u8::MAX as usize)  => true,` won't help but produce another error:
```
error: unexpected token: `(`
 --> src/main.rs:4:17
  |
4 |         n @ ..= (u8::MAX as usize) => true,
  |                 ^

error: could not compile `bug` due to previous error
```
